overview.problemStatement: Is it true that, for all sufficiently large n" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">nnn, if G" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">GGG is a triangle-free graph on {1,…,n}" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">{1,…,n}{1,…,n}\{1,\ldots,n\} then there must exist three independent points a,b,a+b" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">a,b,a+ba,b,a+ba,b,a+b?
